name: Tello-Flip
info:
# Tello Flip

This node will send a command to flip the drone.  The direction to flip is passed in as the **payload**

## Inputs

- payload : The direction to flip.  Valid values are **l**, **r**, **f**, **b** (which represent left, right, forward or back)

## Outputs

This node will return the cmd input parameters with the additional properties

- payload.telloresponse : The response from the drone
- payload.tellosentcmd : The command sent to the drone

name: Tello-Anti-clockwise
info:
# Tello Anti-clockwise

This node will send a command to rotate the drone anti-clockwise.  The angle to rotate is passed in as the **payload**

## Inputs

- payload : The angle to rotate anti-clockwise in degrees.  Valid range is 1-360

## Outputs

This node will return the cmd input parameters with the additional properties

- payload.telloresponse : The response from the drone
- payload.tellosentcmd : The command sent to the drone

name: Tello-Clockwise
info:
# Tello Clockwise

This node will send a command to rotate the drone clockwise.  The angle to rotate is passed in as the **payload**

## Inputs

- payload : The angle to rotate clockwise in degrees.  Valid range is 1-360

## Outputs

This node will return the cmd input parameters with the additional properties

- payload.telloresponse : The response from the drone
- payload.tellosentcmd : The command sent to the drone

name: Tello-Back
info:
# Tello Back

This node will send a command to move the drone back.  The distance to move is passed in as the **payload**

## Inputs

- payload : The distance to move back in cm.  Valid range is 20-500

## Outputs

This node will return the cmd input parameters with the additional properties

- payload.telloresponse : The response from the drone
- payload.tellosentcmd : The command sent to the drone

name: Tello-Forward
info:
# Tello Forward

This node will send a command to move the drone forward.  The distance to move is passed in as the **payload**

## Inputs

- payload : The distance to move forward in cm.  Valid range is 20-500

## Outputs

This node will return the cmd input parameters with the additional properties

- payload.telloresponse : The response from the drone
- payload.tellosentcmd : The command sent to the drone

name: Tello-Left
info:
# Tello Left

This node will send a command to move the drone left.  The distance to move is passed in as the **payload**

## Inputs

- payload : The distance to move left in cm.  Valid range is 20-500

## Outputs

This node will return the cmd input parameters with the additional properties

- payload.telloresponse : The response from the drone
- payload.tellosentcmd : The command sent to the drone

name: Tello-Right
info:
# Tello Right

This node will send a command to move the drone right.  The distance to move is passed in as the **payload**

## Inputs

- payload : The distance to move right in cm.  Valid range is 20-500

## Outputs

This node will return the cmd input parameters with the additional properties

- payload.telloresponse : The response from the drone
- payload.tellosentcmd : The command sent to the drone

name: Tello-Down
info:
# Tello Up

This node will send a command to move the drone down.  The distance to move is passed in as the **payload**

## Inputs

- payload : The distance to move down in cm.  Valid range is 20-500

## Outputs

This node will return the cmd input parameters with the additional properties

- payload.telloresponse : The response from the drone
- payload.tellosentcmd : The command sent to the drone

name: Tello-Up
info:
# Tello Up

This node will send a command to move the drone up.  The distance to move is passed in as the **payload**

## Inputs

- payload : The distance to move up in cm.  Valid range is 20-500

## Outputs

This node will return the cmd input parameters with the additional properties

- payload.telloresponse : The response from the drone
- payload.tellosentcmd : The command sent to the drone

name: Tello-Emergancy
info:
# Tello Emergency

This node will send a command to the drone to immediately stop the motors

## Input

None

## Output

None

name: Tello-Delay
info:
# Tello Delay

This node delays for a number of milliseconds, specificed in the incoming payload.  However, every 10 seconds it sends a **wifi?** command to keep the connection with the drone alive

## Inputs

- payload : number of milliseconds to delay for

## Outputs

None

name: Tello-Takeoff
info:
## Tello Takeoff

This node sends the init command then the takeoff command to instruct the drone to take off

## Inputs

None

## Outputs

None

name: Tello-Land
info:
# Tello Land

This node instructs the Tello drone to land

## Inputs

None

## Outputs

None

name: Tello-Telemetry
info:
# Tello Telemetry

This node returns the telemetry data from the drone.  The Init command has to be used before any data will be received from this node

## Inputs

None

## Outputs

- payload : An object holding the properties representing the current 
drone state

name: Tello-Cmd-Response
info:
# Tello Response

The Tello response node returns any command responses received from the Tello drone

## Inputs

None

## Outputs

- payload : A string received from the drone

name: Tello-Cmd
info:
# Tello Command node

This node sends an SDK command to the tello drone.  It does not return until a response has been received or a timeout period of 1 second has passed.  The timeout period can be overridden by passing in a property

## Inputs

This node takes the following properties

- payload.tellocmd : The command to send to the drone (as specified in the tello SDK)
- payload.tellovalue : An optional parameter to the command
- payload.tellotimeout : An number specifying an override for the default timeout period (in milliseconds)

## Outputs

This node will return the input parameters with an additional response

- payload.telloresponse : The response from the drone
- payload.tellosentcmd : The command sent to the drone

name: Tello-Init
info:
# Tello init

This node sends the **command** command to the drone to enter SDK mode

## Inputs

None

## Outputs

None

name: Open port 8890/udp in Firewall
info:
Open Port 8890/udp in laptop firewall to receive Tello telemetry data.

On Linux
$ sudo firewall-cmd --permanent --add-port=8890/udp

To get the video stream, open port 11111/udp
$ sudo firewall-cmd --permanent --add-port=11111/udp

On Mac, use System Preferences to open the ports.
 - Open System Preferences > Security & Privacy > Firewall > Firewall Options
 - Click the + / Add button
 - Choose 'node' application from the Applications folder and click Add.
 - Ensure that the option next to the application is set to Allow incoming connections.
 - Click OK.

name: ================================ Send Tello SDK Commands =========================
info:
For a list of Tello SDK commands, visit
https://dl-cdn.ryzerobotics.com/downloads/Tello/Tello%20SDK%202.0%20User%20Guide.pdf

name: Open port 8890/udp in Firewall
info:
Open Port 8890/udp in laptop firewall to receive Tello telemetry data.

On Linux
$ sudo firewall-cmd --permanent --add-port=8890/udp

To get the video stream, open port 11111/udp
$ sudo firewall-cmd --permanent --add-port=11111/udp

On Mac, use System Preferences to open the ports.
 - Open System Preferences > Security & Privacy > Firewall > Firewall Options
 - Click the + / Add button
 - Choose 'node' application from the Applications folder and click Add.
 - Ensure that the option next to the application is set to Allow incoming connections.
 - Click OK.
